mods:mods.mods:abstract: Thanks him for the memorial against privateering and the number of The Friend of Peace. The memorial imputes much crime "of the deepest die" to privateering; there are however many instances of criminal violence which cannot be ascribed to this category. Warfare on the ocean as well as on land should conform to the laws of war; it is therefore advisable that privateering be discontinued. Though it is true that commercial navigation would be left vulnerable by this plan, individual sufferings are what make up national distress and compel the offending parties to consent to peace. Concerning increase of crimes, experience will decide whether the severity of our penal laws has been too great or too small. In free states particularly, punishments should be mild and certain; had we been more careful of the latter, malefactors would be less numerous. However, though penal laws can inspire fear they cannot infuse a disposition to rectitude. There is much reason to hope that efforts to extend the influence of the Gospel in this and other countries will increase the number of virtuous individuals.
